intro: Protolindsaya brooksii, commonly known as the Brooksii lindsaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
